nodes.text: The hon. Gentleman's argument should not be considered
The hon Gentleman is not a person that is interested in the security of his homeland
The hon Gentleman is playing into the hands of the terrorists
Playing into the hands of terrorists carping and criticizing is a bad action

Is he on the side of creating a democratic Iraq in which its people can take control of their lives for the very first time for at least a generation or does he want to carp and criticise playing into the hands of the terrorists who are seeking to undermine our forces there?
The hon Gentleman does not support the war
The hon. Gentleman rightly raised it but I question the tone in which he did so.
The best explanation of the hon. Gentleman's tone is that he does not support the war
